item.title: Addressing the Teacher Shortage in Maldives: A Call for Local Educators
item.description: Maldivian schools follow the globally recognized Cambridge curriculum, emphasizing a high standard of education. However, the dearth of qualified teachers, especially those proficient in English, hampers the effective implementation of this curriculum. Recognizing the importance of local educators who possess a deep understanding of the Maldivian culture and context, the Ministry of Education has been working diligently to address this issue. Over the past five years, there has been a steady increase in the number of Maldivian teachers.

item.title: Overcoming Education Challenges in the Maldives: Progress and Initiatives
item.description: Low Enrollment and Remarkable Progress When UNICEF arrived in the Maldives, only 15 percent of children were enrolled in primary schools. This low enrollment rate posed a significant challenge for the education sector. However, through collaborative efforts, the Maldives has witnessed a remarkable improvement in primary school enrollment, which now stands at an impressive 96 percent. This achievement is a testament to the commitment of the government and various organizations in ensuring that every child has access to education.
